member.name: T:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.Redirects.RedirectValidator
member.summary: Filters HTTP redirects (status code 3xx) - checks if the new location is trusted (whitelist) and may protect and/or report it. Prevents the "Redirects" part from 'Unvalidated Redirects and Forwards' - https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10_2013-A10-Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards More info on how to protect - https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards_Cheat_Sheet

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.SecurityModuleResourcesTitle
member.summary: Gets Web Security module labels

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.SecurityModuleResourcesDescription
member.summary: Gets localizable resources for help information such as UI elements descriptions, usage explanations, FAQ and etc.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.SecurityHeadersSection
member.summary: These settings are applicable only for the Siteinity backend and when MVC is used for the frontend. When Sitefinity ASP.NET Core is used please visit section AspNetCoreRenderer. Security headers instruct the client (browser) how to protect the user from security vulnerabilities. They are sent with each successful response from the server. Note: If some of those headers have been applied in the response (e.g. by code or server level configuration) those configured in Sitefinity won't be used to prevent duplications. They are only set if no such header is present already.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.RedirectValidationSection
member.summary: Redirect Validation provides protection from \"Open Redirect\" type of attacks. For more information check https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10_2013-A10-Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards or http://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/601.html.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.RefererValidationSection
member.summary: Referer Validation provides protection from \"Cross-Site Request Forgery\" type of attacks. For more information check https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Cross-Site_Request_Forgery_(CSRF) or https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/352.html.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.CookiesProtectorSection
member.summary: Provides common configurations for server-side generated cookies and helps protect your site from XSRF, XSS and stealing sensitive data.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.CsrfProtectionSection
member.summary: Provides common configurations for CSRF protection.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.DisableHttpResponseSecurityHeadersCaption
member.summary: Disable sending security http headers in the response. (Not recommended)

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.DisableHttpResponseSecurityHeadersDescription
member.summary: If you disable sending them from Sitefinity they should be configured on the server or by code. It is strongly recommended to send them always.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.HttpResponseSecurityHeadersCaption
member.summary: Response Security

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.HttpResponseSecurityHeadersDescription
member.summary: Http Headers that could be configured and sent with each response from the server. Note: If some of those headers have been applied in the response (e.g. by code or server level configuration) the configured headers below won't be used to prevent duplications. They are only set if no such header is present already.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.XFrameOptionsDescription
member.summary: Helps protecting against clickjacking attacks. For more information for its usage check https://www.progress.com/sf-clickjacking

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.StrictTransportSecurityDescription
member.summary: Prevents sending data over unencrypted channel (when a secured one is available). Strict - Transport - Security - HSTS tells browsers that content should only be communicated with using HTTPS, instead of using HTTP. It converts automatically all HTTP requests to HTTPS if the site has been opened previously with HTTPS with valid certificate. For more information for its usage check https://www.progress.com/sf-hsts

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.XContentTypeOptionsDescription
member.summary: Prevents Content sniffing for styles and scripts. For more information for its usage check https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Content-Type-Options

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.XXssProtectionDescription
member.summary: Prevents reflected cross site scripting attacks. Default value (1; mode=block) prevents rendering the page if an attack is detected. Report uri could be specified for auditing purposes X-XSS-Protection: 1; report=/Sitefinity/Frontend/Diagnostics/HttpHeadersReport?header=X-XSS-Protection. In case of using the default report uri you could check the violation reports in the Diagnostics module > Http Headers profiler. For more information for its usage check https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-XSS-Protection"

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.PublicKeyPinsDescription
member.summary: Tells a web client to associate a specific cryptographic public key with a certain web server to decrease the risk of MITM attacks with forged certificates. Report uri could be specified for auditing purposes (report-uri=/Sitefinity/Frontend/Diagnostics/HttpHeadersReport?header=Public-Key-Pins). For more information for its usage check https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Public_Key_Pinning

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.PublicKeyPinsReportOnlyDescription
member.summary: The HTTP Public-Key-Pins-Report-Only response header sends reports of pinning violation to the report-uri specified in the header but, unlike Public-Key-Pins still allows browsers to connect to the server if the pinning is violated (report-uri=/Sitefinity/Frontend/Diagnostics/HttpHeadersReport?header=Public-Key-Pins-Report-Only). In case of using the default report uri you could check the violation reports in the Diagnostics module > Http Headers profiler. For more information for its usage check https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Public-Key-Pins-Report-Only.

member.summary: word: More

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.LessResource

member.summary: Referrer information policy

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.ReferrerPolicyDescription
member.summary: Governs which referrer information, sent in the Referer header, should be included with requests made. For more information for its usage check https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Referrer-Policy

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.NoReferrer
member.summary: No referrer

member.summary: Do not send referrer information

member.summary: No referrer when downgrade

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.NoReferrerWhenDowngradeTooltipMessage
member.summary: Do not send referrer when navigating from HTTPS to HTTP page. Else, send full URL.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.Origin
member.summary: Origin

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.OriginTooltipMessage
member.summary: Send domain only, not full URL.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.UnsafeUrl
member.summary: Full URL

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.UnsafeUrlTooltipMessage
member.summary: Send full URL. This policy may cause security issues.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.OriginWhenCrossOrigin
member.summary: Origin when cross origin

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.OriginWhenCrossOriginTooltipMessage
member.summary: Send full URL when navigating to a page from the same site. Send domain only when navigating to other sites.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.SameOrigin
member.summary: Same origin

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.SameOriginTooltipMessage
member.summary: Send full URL when navigating to a page from the same site. Do not send referrer information when navigating to other sites.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.StrictOrigin
member.summary: Strict origin

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.StrictOriginTooltipMessage
member.summary: Send domain when navigating to HTTPS pages. Else, do not send referrer information.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.StrictOriginWhenCrossOrigin
member.summary: Strict origin when cross origin

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.StrictOriginWhenCrossOriginTooltipMessage
member.summary: Send full URL when navigating to a page from the same site. Send domain when navigating to HTTPS pages from other sites. Else, do not send referrer information. Otherwise, don't send refferer information.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.CrossOriginOpenerPolicyDescription
member.summary: The HTTP Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy (COOP) response header allows you to ensure a top-level document does not share a browsing context group with cross-origin documents.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.CrossOriginEmbedderPolicyDescription
member.summary: The HTTP Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy (COEP) response header prevents a document from loading any cross-origin resources that don't explicitly grant the document permission (using CORP or CORS).

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.CrossOriginResourcePolicyDescription
member.summary: The HTTP Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy response header conveys a desire that the browser blocks no-cors cross-origin/cross-site requests to the given resource.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.PermissionsPolicyDescription
member.summary: Permissions Policy (formerly known as feature policy) allows web developers to selectively enable, disable, and modify the behavior of certain APIs and web features in the browser.

member.summary: Trusted locations

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.TrustedLocationsDescription
member.summary: Comma separated list of URLs that are considered trusted and won't trigger the confirmation screen. Licensed domains and site domains are considered trusted by default. (e.g. https://somesite.com, https://anothersite.info)

member.summary: Proceed with caution!

member.summary: Phrase: For your safety never enter your password for

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.OnThisSite
member.summary: Phrase: on this site

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.ORDescription
member.summary: Be warned that any time you see this message you may be heading to a non-trusted site. Untrusted sites may contain malware or may imitate the design of other sites in attempt to deceit you to give away credentials, personal or financial information.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.ORGoHomePage
member.summary: Go to homepage

member.summary: Proceed to {0}

member.summary: Disable referer validation.

member.summary: Trusted referer locations

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.TrustedRefererLocationsDescription
member.summary: Comma separated list of URLs that are considered trusted and won't trigger the confirmation screen. Licensed domains and site domains are considered trusted by default. (e.g. somesite.com, anothersite.info)

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.EnableCookiesProtectorCaption
member.summary: Enable cookies protection

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.EnableCookiesProtectorDescription
member.summary: If not enabled, the CookiesProtector settings are ignored and you can configure protection for each cookie separately.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.SkippedCookiesCaption
member.summary: Skipped Cookies

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.SkippedCookiesDescription
member.summary: Enter a comma-separated list of cookie names (or name parts) of all cookies that you want omitted from this protection configuration.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.HttpOnlyCaption
member.summary: HttpOnly

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.HttpOnlyDescription
member.summary: Restricts client-side scripts from accessing the cookies. Cookies can only be accessed by the server via HTTP protocol.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.SecureCaption
member.summary: Secure

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.SecureDescription
member.summary: Prevents browsers from sending cookies over unencrypted HTTP requests. Cookies are sent only over HTTPS requests.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.SameSiteCaption
member.summary: SameSite

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.SameSiteDescription
member.summary: Prevents browsers from sending cookies on cross-site requests. To prevent sending cookies for all types of cross-site requests, select "Strict". To allow sending cookies only with GET requests, select "Lax". To skip this prevention, select "None".

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.EnableCsrfProtectionCaption
member.summary: Enable CSRF protection

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.WebSecurity.WebSecurityResources.EnableCsrfProtectionDescription
member.summary: If not enabled, the CSRF protection will not be applied for submitted Sitefinity form widgets and login widgets.
